citation.article-title: Hespellia stercorisuis gen. nov., sp. nov. and Hespellia porcina sp. nov., isolated from swine manure storage pits.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Hespellia (Hes.pel′li.a. N.L. fem. n. Hespellia to honour the late American microbiologist Robert B. Hespell, in recognition of his many contributions to anaerobic microbiology).
Strictly anaerobic and catalase- and oxidase-negative.
Glucose and some other sugars are fermented.
Major end products of glucose metabolism are formic, acetic, lactic and propionic acids; hydrogen is produced.
Aesculin and starch are hydrolysed, but gelatin is not.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Long-chain cellular FAs consist of complex mixtures of FAs and DMAs, together with small amounts of ALDs.
The type species of the genus is Hespellia stercorisuis.
